part.name: Liquid Cooling Garment
part.description: The innermost layer of the EVA suit. Provides thermal control by circulating air and water cooled by a sublimator over crew member's body. Can handle peak loads of up to 500 kcal/hr for 15 minutes, 400 kcal/hr for up to an hour, or 250 kcal/hr for up to 7 hours.

part.name: Pressure Suit
part.description: Spandex inner EVA suit for counter pressure.

part.name: Coveralls
part.description: Outer EVA suit with insulative liner.

part.name: EVA Boots
part.description: steel soled and tipped. Fiberglass insulated.

part.name: EVA Pads

part.name: EVA backpack
part.description: The backpack is the most crucial part of the Portable Life-Support System (PLSS). It is made with polyethylene and a steel frame.

part.name: EVA Battery
part.description: Assuming the future achievement of 1 kg/kWh or 1 kWh/kg, (as of 4 Aug 2024 CATL Condensed battery has 500 Wh/kg) this rechargeable battery module is rated for 150 W at 18V. for providing 8 hrs of electrical power to the EVA suit. Energy capacity: 150 W * 8 hrs = 1.2 kWh. Weight: 1.2 kWh / 1 kWh/kg = 1.2 kg. Amperage: 1.2 kWh / 18 Volt = 66.67 Ah.

part.name: Battery Module
part.description: Assuming the future achievement of 1 kg/kWh or 1 kWh/kg, this 15 kWh rechargeable battery provides 'auxiliary' electrical power to the vehicle, on top of the primary fuel cell stack. With 15 kWh capacity, or it's 37.5 Ah (= 15/.4) and is rated to operate at 400V. Assume 6.43 km/kWh (based on a Tesla Model S battery pack weighing 2240 kg with 100 kWh capacity that can travel 643 km), this battery allows traveling a distance of 96.5 km on a single charge.

part.name: Vehicle Frame small

part.description: Reinforced fiberglass panels.

part.description: Reinforced fiberglass panels.

part.name: Rover Wheel
part.description: Rover wheels are made of durable steel wires and Nickel-titanium alloy wires. See 'kinky' wire wheel at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vSNtifE0Z2Q Read Martensite at https://www.tf.uni-kiel.de/matwis/amat/iss/kap_8/backbone/r8_4_1.html Shape memory alloys (SMAs) https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1747-1567.2008.00410.x Nickel-titanium alloy https://www.space.com/39305-metal-tires-for-mars-rovers.html Nitinol wire https://space.stackexchange.com/questions/23758/are-these-experimental-stoichiometric-niti-wire-mesh-wheels-made-from-memory-al

part.name: Bot Head

part.name: Actuator
part.description:
An actuator in a robot is a device that converts energy into physical motion, enabling the robot to interact with its environment. Actuators serve as the "muscles" of a robot, executing movements based on signals from control systems like microcontrollers or software.
They vary in design and function but all share the core purpose of translating electrical, hydraulic, or pneumatic energy into mechanical force.
The role of actuators extends beyond just movement, as they also contribute to the robot's ability to sense and respond to its environment by providing feedback to the control system about the robot's position and movement.
Unlike a servo motor, a actuator provides linear motion and operates in a simple on/off manner without position control.
Arms: 6 Legs: 4 Torso: 2 Neck: 2

part.name: Servo Motor
part.description:
A servo motor is used in applications where precise angular control is needed, such as in robotics and RC vehicles, where they can move to a specific position and hold it. Additionally, servo motors typically offer higher speed and better torque at higher speeds compared to stepper motors.
Feet: 2 Hands: 6

part.name: Gear
part.description: A gear represents a myriad of industrial grade gears for use inside a gearbox.

part.name: Gearbox
part.description: A gearbox ensure smooth motion, high torque, and energy efficiency, making them essential in robotic systems. Among the most popular types of gearboxes are planetary gearboxes, strain wave gearboxes (harmonic drive gearboxes), and RV gearboxes. Read https://newstartgear.com/application/industrial-robotic-application/

part.name: Stepper Motor
part.description: A 24 V precision motor provides precise positioning, such as 3D printers and CNC machines, where they can move in small, controlled increments.

part.name: Motor 5 kW
part.description: A motor with 5 kW power output can be used in hybrid models and automotive accessories such as power windows, seats, and windshield wipers, where moderate power is needed. Additionally, 5 kW electric motors are used in home appliances like refrigerators, air conditioners, and washing machines, offering good energy efficiency and performance balance. In the case of golf carts, a 5 kW motor can provide sufficient power for the vehicle's operation,

part.name: High Pressure Sodium lamp
part.description: High Intensity Discharge (HID), and more specifically, High Pressure Sodium (HPS) lights have long been used as indoor grow lights, particularly for the late vegetative and flowering/fruiting stages of growth.

part.name: Polycarbonate roofing
part.description: Assume 2m x 2m, highly transparent, "bullet-resistant" plastic cladding roofing for greenhouses

part.name: Methane Fuel cell
part.description: Assume each solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) can generate 200W with the achievement of 1kWh/kg. Weight: 200W * 1kWh/kg = 0.2 kg

part.name: Methane Fuel cell stack
part.description: A 15 kW Solid Oxide Fuel Cell (SOFC) stack comprises 75 fuel cells, furnished with valves, coolant and pump, filter, sensors, cold plate and heat pipes.

part.name: Methanol Fuel cell
part.description: Assume each methanol fuel cell can generate 200W continuous power.

part.name: Methanol Fuel cell stack
part.description: A 15 kW Reformed Methanol Fuel Cell (RMFC) stack comprises 75 fuel cells and heat exchanger, radiator and supporting structure.

part.name: Telescoping antenna
part.description: This long transmitting antenna serves to transmit telemetry data for a portable science station in the field.

part.name: Gas Chromatograph
part.description: This portable lab instrument separates the constituents of a volatile substance and is used to gas content analysis.

part.name: Mass Spectrometer
part.description: This portable apparatus can separate isotopes and molecular fragments according to mass. The sample is vaporized and ionized, and the ions are accelerated in an electric field and deflected by a magnetic field into a curved trajectory that gives a distinctive mass spectrum.

part.name: X-Ray Fluorescene Spectrometer
part.description: This portable apparatus is used to perform non-destructive chemical analysis of rocks, minerals, sediments and fluids.

part.name: Infra-Red Spectrometer
part.description: This portable instrument can identify and study chemicals on a given sample (solid, liquid, or gaseous) by using IR spectroscopy to produce an infrared spectrum of the sample.

part.name: Heat Probe
part.description: This instrument is used for thermometry applications in that one can measure temperature inside fluid containers, tanks, and pipes and underground environment

part.name: Turbopump
part.description: This turbopump is compatible with delivering liquid methane. The purpose of a turbopump is to produce a high pressure fluid for feeding a combustion chamber.

part.name: Heat pipe
part.description: Heat pipe is a passive heat transfer device with an extremely effective thermal conductivity. Its two-phase heat transfer mechanism results in heat transfer capabilities from one hundred to several thousand times that of an equivalent piece of copper.

part.description: an utility hammer for light use

part.description: Useful for cleaning up a chemical spill.

part.description: a printed circuit board (PCB) that mechanically supports and electrically connects electronic components using conductive tracks, pads and other features etched from copper sheets laminated onto a non-conductive substrate.

part.name: Work gloves
part.description: a pair of utility work gloves for medium to heavy use.

part.name: Optical cable
part.description: a cable made of optic fiber

part.name: Petri dish
part.description: a small dish shaped like a cylinder for growing cells. Made of polystyrene.

part.name: Plasma cutter
part.description: Plasma is electrified gas. a plasma cutter will cut any material that conducts electricity. Aluminum, steel, stainless, brass, copper, etc.

part.name: Flood light
part.description: a LED outdoor weather-proof, adjustable flood light with tripod stand

part.name: Aerogel tile
part.description: Assume each tile is about 1m x 1m. Excellent for transparent insulation, a silica aerogel tile contain nanoscale networks of interconnecting silica clusters, contain over 97% air by volume and have some of the lowest measured thermal conductivities of any known material (of 0.02 W/m/K at 1 bar pressure or 0.01 W/m/K at Martian atmospheric pressure). Routinely employed in many engineering applications, including NASA’s Mars Exploration Rovers where thin aerogel layers provided night-time thermal insulation. A 3 cm layer of silica aerogel can increase the temperature of the underlying surface by 45 K when it receives a flux of 150 W/m2.

part.name: Insulation board
part.description: Assume each tile is about 1m x 1m. Each board comprises extruded polystyrene (XPS) and expanded polystyrene insulation (EPS) that contain millions of air pockets trapped within the foam. Because the polystyrene itself is also highly resistant to heat, the result is a great thermal insulator which can give excellent R-ratings. XPS is often lined with aluminium foil.

part.name: Biosensor
part.description: A biopolymer sensor that can be printed on a wide range of materials for sensing trace levels of pollutants/toxins or whatever airborne/waterborne bacteria and virus. It contains embedded molecular switches consisting of a protein that acts like a lock and key. A target molecule or pathogen binds to the switch, which opens the 'lock' to combine to form an enzyme and emits a light indicating the presence and quantity of the target. Useful for pathogen detection, food analysis, medical monitoring, and measurement of pollutants

part.name: CMOS sensor
part.description: Complementary Metal–Oxide–Semiconductor(CMOS) consists of millions of pixel sensors, each of which includes a photodetector.

part.name: Electrostatic Precipitator
part.description: A filterless device that removes fine particles, like dust and smoke, from a flowing gas using the force of an induced electrostatic charge minimally impeding the flow of gases through the unit

part.name: Water Heater 5kW
part.description: A tankless water heater rated 5kW.

part.name: Wash Brush
part.description: For manual vehicle cleaning.

part.name: Pressure Washer
part.description: A electric pressure washer provides 2.5 GPM. consumes 1.5 kW
